article_title: Apartments crawling with mice, roaches but fearful tenants stay quiet
article_text:
00:26 Crews cut massive bridge girders at the Johnson County Gateway interchange Pause

02:15 New report cites missteps that led to deaths of two Kansas City firefighters

01:19 Man killed when his car runs him over

00:29 Union Station streetcar switch halts service

01:46 Tiny houses to shelter homeless veterans

02:34 Margaret Lamkin had to fight for her life after eating tenderized beef

article_metadata.news-keywords: apartments, mice, roaches, mold, tenant, Fresno, inspection, projects, housing, heat, toilet, low income, residents
article_metadata.description: Shocking conditions at south and central Fresno apartment complexes spur The Bee to focus on substandard housing in a four-month investigation that found the city does not routinely inspect apartments. Tenants are left to live in squalor.
article_metadata.title: Apartments crawling with mice, roaches but fearful tenants stay quiet | The Kansas City Star
